include/ulib/base/replace/sysexits.h

00001 /* sysexits.h - system-dependent definitions */
00002 
00003 //#if defined(HAVE_SYSEXITS_H) // || !defined(HAVE_CONFIG_H)
00004 //#include <sysexits.h>
00005 //#else
00006 /* sysexits.h
00007  *
00008  * Error numbers begin at EX__BASE to reduce the possibility of
00009  * clashing with other exit statuses that random programs may
00010  * already return.  The meaning of the codes is approximately
00011  * as follows:
00012  *
00013  * EX_USAGE -- The command was used incorrectly, e.g., with
00014  *    the wrong number of arguments, a bad flag, a bad
00015  *    syntax in a parameter, or whatever.
00016  * EX_DATAERR -- The input data was incorrect in some way.
00017  *    This should only be used for user's data & not
00018  *    system files.
00019  * EX_NOINPUT -- An input file (not a system file) did not
00020  *    exist or was not readable. This could also include
00021  *    errors like "No message" to a mailer (if it cared
00022  *    to catch it).
00023  * EX_NOUSER -- The user specified did not exist. This might
00024  *    be used for mail addresses or remote logins.
00025  * EX_NOHOST -- The host specified did not exist. This is used
00026  *    in mail addresses or network requests.
00027  * EX_UNAVAILABLE -- A service is unavailable. This can occur
00028  *    if a support program or file does not exist. This
00029  *    can also be used as a catchall message when something
00030  *    you wanted to do doesn't work, but you don't know
00031  *    why.
00032  * EX_SOFTWARE -- An internal software error has been detected.
00033  *    This should be limited to non-operating system related
00034  *    errors as possible.
00035  * EX_OSERR -- An operating system error has been detected.
00036  *    This is intended to be used for such things as "cannot
00037  *    fork", "cannot create pipe", or the like. It includes
00038  *    things like getuid returning a user that does not
00039  *    exist in the passwd file.
00040  * EX_OSFILE -- Some system file (e.g., /etc/passwd, /etc/utmp,
00041  *    etc.) does not exist, cannot be opened, or has some
00042  *    sort of error (e.g., syntax error).
00043  * EX_CANTCREAT -- A (user specified) output file cannot be
00044  *    created.
00045  * EX_IOERR -- An error occurred while doing I/O on some file.
00046  * EX_TEMPFAIL -- temporary failure, indicating something that
00047  *    is not really an error. In sendmail, this means
00048  *    that a mailer (e.g.) could not create a connection,
00049  *    and the request should be reattempted later.
00050  * EX_PROTOCOL -- the remote system returned something that
00051  *    was "not possible" during a protocol exchange.
00052  * EX_NOPERM -- You did not have sufficient permission to
00053  *    perform the operation. This is not intended for
00054  *    file system problems, which should use NOINPUT or
00055  *    CANTCREAT, but rather for higher level permissions.
00056 */
00057 #  define EX_OK            0  // successful termination
00058 #  define EX__BASE         64 // base value for error messages
00059 #  define EX_USAGE         64 // command line usage error
00060 #  define EX_DATAERR       65 // data format error
00061 #  define EX_NOINPUT       66 // cannot open input
00062 #  define EX_NOUSER        67 // addressee unknown
00063 #  define EX_NOHOST        68 // host name unknown
00064 #  define EX_UNAVAILABLE   69 // service unavailable
00065 #  define EX_SOFTWARE      70 // internal software error
00066 #  define EX_OSERR         71 // system error (e.g., can't fork)
00067 #  define EX_OSFILE        72 // critical OS file missing
00068 #  define EX_CANTCREAT     73 // can't create (user) output file
00069 #  define EX_IOERR         74 // input/output error
00070 #  define EX_TEMPFAIL      75 // temp failure; user is invited to retry
00071 #  define EX_PROTOCOL      76 // remote error in protocol
00072 #  define EX_NOPERM        77 // permission denied
00073 #  define EX_CONFIG        78 // configuration error
00074 #  define EX__MAX          78 // maximum listed value
00075 //#endif
Generated on Tue Feb 2 20:00:47 2010 for ULib C++ Library by  1.6.1
